intro: Odontolophus, commonly known as the horned orchid, is a genus of flowering plants in the orchid family. These plants are characterized by their unique, often strikingly shaped flowers with prominent, horn-like projections. They are native to various regions in South America, particularly in the Andes. Odontolophus species typically grow in high-altitude environments, where they thrive in cool, moist conditions. Their botanical features include intricate floral structures and specialized adaptations for pollination by specific insect species.
